MultiMony

Handling Multiple Display-Monitor Environments

Authors

hoppfrosch: Original

Information

Properties
debug [get/set]

Debug flag for debugging the object

Value
flag

true or false

idPrimary [get]

Get the ID of the primary monitor

Remarks

  • There is no setter available, since this is a constant system property

idTaskbar [get]

Get the ID of the monitor where the taskbar is on (aka. primary monitor)

Remarks

  • There is no setter available, since this is a constant system property

monitorsCount [get]

Number of available monitors.

Remarks

  • There is no setter available, since this is a constant system property

size [get]

Get the size of virtual screen in Pixel as a rectangle.

The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors

Remarks

  • There is no setter available, since this is a constant system property

See Also

virtualScreenSize [get]

version [get]

Version of the class

Remarks

  • There is no setter available, since this is a constant system property

virtualScreenSize [get]

Get the size of virtual screen in Pixel as a rectangle.

The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors

Remarks

  • There is no setter available, since this is a constant system property

See Also

size [get]

Functions
coordDisplayToVirtualScreen
coordDisplayToVirtualScreen(
id := 1,
x := 0,
y := 0
)

Transforms coordinates relative to given monitor into absolute (virtual) coordinates. Returns object of type point

Parameters
id

id of the monitor

x,y

relative coordinates on given monitor

Returns

point.

coordVirtualScreenToDisplay(
x,
y
)

Transforms absolute coordinates from Virtual Screen into coordinates relative to screen.

Parameters
x,y

absolute coordinates

Returns

Object containing relative coordinates and monitorID

identify
identify(
disptime := 1500,
txtcolor := "000000",
txtsize := 300
)

Identify monitors by displaying the monitor id on each monitor

Parameters
disptime

time to display the monitor id (Optional, Default: 1500[ms])

txtcolor

color of the displayed monitor id (Optional, Default: "000000")

txtsize

size of the displayed monitor id (Optional, Default: 300[px])

idNext
idNext(
currMon := 1,
cycle := true
)

Gets the id of the next monitor.

Parameters
id

monitor, whose next monitorid has to be determined

cycle

*== 1* cycle through monitors; *== 0* stop at last monitor (Optional, Default: 1)

See Also

idPrev

idPrev
idPrev(
currMon := 1,
cycle := true
)

Gets the id of the previous monitor

Parameters
id

monitor, whose previous monitor id has to be determined

cycle

*== true* cycle through monitors; *== false* stop at first monitor (Optional, Default: true)

See Also

idNext

monitors
monitors()

Enumerates display monitors and returns an object all monitors (list of Mony object )

Returns
monitors

associative array with monitor id as key and Mony objects as values

__New(
_debug= false
)

Parameters
